ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot of new vocab and grammar structures, and I improved my speaking and comprehension skills.
I was able to better develop my Spanish grammar
In depth understanding of speaking, reading and writing Spanish. The course is very intense and is designed to get you up to speed with a baseline level of Spanish.
Learned a ton of useful Spanish vocab and grammar, and also improved my speaking, reading, and writing skills.
I continued my Spanish education.
ability to speak, write, read, and understand spanish

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was taught at a very fast pace, which meant we got through a lot of material, but sometimes it was hard to keep up. It also demanded a large amount of work outside of class, which also helped my Spanish skills, but not all of which felt necessary.

Strengths: great course and amazing enthusiastic teacher
Weaknesses: large workload

Strengths: Profesora Sab did a great job making this class actually fun, which I was surprised about. I legitimately laughed in class about once a week. Also, it always felt hard but never unmanageably hard, and very little of it felt unfair.

Weaknesses: Nothing that I think can be changed.

The strength of the course was definitely the professor. Prof Maria Lourdes was so lively, energetic and passionate about not only teaching but conveying the material properly. She is very meticulous and diligent in the way she graded along with providing detailed feedback. The biggest weakness is the workload, even though the language itself is not the hardest, there is always a lot of work. Presentations, projects, homework and other graded assignments really pile up over the course of a semester and can feel like a huge burden if you're taking other courses that demand a lot of effort.

Very strong curriculum that actually teaches you Spanish. Loved the emphasis on speaking. The amount of content in the last couple months was a lot, and felt a bit lopsided towards the end, but otherwise solid.

Strengths: well organized, engaging
Weaknesses: inconsistent work load
i loved it & i have no comments

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 120 is much harder and much more work than 110. If you can set aside the time for the daily homework and weekly projects, along with studying for the class, you'll be fine.

I have been very impressed with the Spanish department so far. Although I am taking language classes because I have to, I do feel like the program is very well organized and focused. If you are looking to learn a language, I would guess that Spanish is one of the better programs at Yale.
Yes, if you want to become better at Spanish please take it !

At the end of the day, it's Spanish, so you know what you're getting yourself into. I've heard the Spanish department is better than some of the other language departments in that it doesn't have finals or assign impossible projects, so maybe in that way yes. As for Profesora Sab, she made the class feel like a community even while we were all wading through the mess that is learning an L2 language, and I genuinely enjoyed coming to class most days.

Only if you're really interested in Spanish and preferably have some prior experience in the language. It is a lot of work, and by a lot I mean a lot. Definitely not a chill language class, be ready to work consistently. If you're looking to fulfill the language requirement in a relaxed manner, take something like Portuguese or Indonesian. However, if you love the language that much and are willing to put in the work for this class, by all means take it. The professor is fantastic!
If you genuinely want to learn Spanish, I highly recommend this course. Would recommend.
I would recommend this course to any student looking to continue their Spanish education.
i would STRONGLY recommend it.
